tasks.task: Pruning fruit trees in the orchard during winter.
subtasks: Identify inward-growing branches and remove them.
Check the angle of branches; prefer a 90-degree angle.
Remove overlapping branches to prevent rubbing.
Trim branches that shade other branches to promote sunlight.
Use a utility knife saw for cutting larger branches.
Clean pruning tools between trees to prevent disease spread.
Promote air circulation by removing congested growth.
Maintain a balance between tree height and accessibility for harvesting.
Consider long-term growth and structural integrity when making cuts.
